text: application to permit cross-examination by two counsel
courts discretion whether to permit application to cross-examine by two counsel
importance of continuity of counsel present during cross-examination to the exercise of the discretion to permit
importance of the nature of witness sought to be cross-examined

application to permit cross-examination of witness by two counsel allowed  acts cited:  decision:  i allow the application in the terms in which it was made, and grant leave to the defendants to further cross-examine mr hogarth by either mr officer qc or mr powell, on areas and materials previously not covered by the cross-examination of mr shand, but permitting further cross-examination on credit generally.
application to the trial judge for leave to appeal from an interlocutory judgment of that judge, refused
